text: Hm, good question... I'm a bit worried that if we embed like the live version of vega and vega-lite plots for the thumbnails that we end up having these recomputed constantly, or something like that... Or if we have for example an interactive vega or vega-lite graph, we might end up having the interactivity in the thumbnail view as well. So I almost think it would be better to have "static" thumbnail in that view that we generate somehow once when the plot gets shown for the first time, and then use there? Not 100% sure, <@U6BNE7LTZ> what is your take on that?

elements.text: Hm, good question... I'm a bit worried that if we embed like the live version of vega and vega-lite plots for the thumbnails that we end up having these recomputed constantly, or something like that... Or if we have for example an interactive vega or vega-lite graph, we might end up having the interactivity in the thumbnail view as well. So I almost think it would be better to have "static" thumbnail in that view that we generate somehow once when the plot gets shown for the first time, and then use there? Not 100% sure,
what is your take on that?

text: Yes. Imho we should try to generate an additional png for every plot (by calling `show(io, MIME"image/png"(), plot)` in a timeout or whatever) and show that in the preview pane

in a timeout or whatever) and show that in the preview pane

text: if that isn't possible then we just show a fallback graphic
